alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Monroe; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 4:31AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Widespread flooding from previous rainfall is expected to continue through the morning. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Belmont, Guernsey, Monroe, Muskingum and Noble. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 424 AM EDT, There have been multiple reports of flooding occurring across the warned area where between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell last evening. Particular areas of concern include locations along the west, middle, and east forks of Duck Creek, as well as Dyes fork, Sharon fork, and Olive Green Creek. Flooding is expected to continue as upstream gage at Harrietsville is still slowly going up as of 420 AM - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cambridge, Caldwell, New Concord, Byesville, Dudley, Quaker City, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Cumberland, Lore City, Old Washington, Summerfield, Belle Valley, Lewisville, Sarahsville, Dexter City, Salesville, High Hill, Stafford and Graysville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
